other_tests.findings: Pathology revealed adenocarcinoma in the right mid apex, with a Gleason score of 6, involving 10% of a single biopsy core from among a total of 10 cores taken at biopsy. Two other cores revealed high-grade prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia and 1 focus of atypia suspicious for adenocarcinoma.
PSA level was found to be elevated at 5.3 ng/mL (previously 3.0 ng/mL a year earlier) and was reported as 4.5 ng/mL two months after biopsy, indicating an inconsistent rate of change.
other_tests.changes_over_time: PSA level changed from 5.3 ng/mL to 4.5 ng/mL over four months, indicating a decrease.

other_tests.findings: Testosterone was in the normal range at 362 ng/dL.
